intro: Cynanchica aristata subsp. condensata, commonly known as the dense milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to greenish flowers arranged in racemes, which are typically followed by legume-like pods containing seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with low precipitation and poor soil conditions. The subspecies is distinguished by its denser foliage and more compact growth habit compared to other members of the species.
